content.raw: I just ran it through solidworks, here's all the data you need for two versions of density (one with the default 0.001 g/mm^3 =  1615.61184g and the other with 0.00093g/mm^3 = 1502.51902g to match the 1.5kg specified in the qualification document ... so the one you'll want to use is the first one in the document I guess as that's the one resulting in a mass of 1.5kg): http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/mass_properties_drill.pdf
content.html: I just ran it through solidworks, here's all the data you need for two versions of density (one with the default 0.001 g/mm^3 = 1615.61184g and the other with 0.00093g/mm^3 = 1502.51902g to match the 1.5kg specified in the qualification document ... so the one you'll want to use is the first one in the document I guess as that's the one resulting in a mass of 1.5kg): http://www.seas.upenn.edu/~thomasko/mass_properties_drill.pdf
